title: Introduction to Data Science
subject: Data Science
theory: Data Science is an interdisciplinary field that uses scientific methods, processes, algorithms, and systems to extract knowledge and insights from noisy, structured, and unstructured data. It combines expertise from statistics, computer science, and domain knowledge.

examples.explanation: Example applications include recommendation systems (Netflix), fraud detection (Banking), and self-driving cars (Tesla).

common_mistakes.correction: Data Science uses AI as a tool, but it also focuses on data cleaning, visualization, and statistical analysis which might not involve AI models.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between Supervised and Unsupervised learning?
interview_questions.answer: Supervised learning uses labeled data (input-output pairs) to train algorithms. Unsupervised learning finds patterns in unlabeled data.

real_world_use_cases.description: Predicting customer churn to offer retention incentives.

summary: Data Science is the art of turning data into value.
